meanings.sent1: The elephant looked tuskier than the others in the herd.
meanings.sent2: The walrus is a tuskier animal compared to the seal.
meanings.sent3: The tuskier walrus challenged the others to a tusk-measuring contest.
meanings.sent4: His tuskier grin revealed a mischievous nature.
meanings.sent5: The tuskier tusks of the boar gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The new sculpture had a tuskier appearance than the previous one.
meanings.sent2: The tuskier design of the mask made it stand out in the collection.
meanings.sent3: The tuskier handle of the knife made it easier to grip.
meanings.sent4: Her tuskier necklace added a unique touch to her outfit.
meanings.sent5: The tuskier texture of the fabric gave it a rough feel.

meanings.sent1: The mammoth's tusks were tuskier than those of the mastodon.
meanings.sent2: The rhino's horn looked tuskier after it was polished.
meanings.sent3: The tuskier end of the stick was perfect for digging in the dirt.
meanings.sent4: The tuskier shape of the sword made it more intimidating.
meanings.sent5: The tuskier curve of the horn added elegance to the sculpture.
